intro: Hesperis nitens, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Hesperis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white or pale purple, and appear in clusters during the spring season. Hesperis nitens is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
